intro: Amaracarpus attenuatus, commonly known as the slender amara, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture. It is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and wetlands.
